  Class java.Nutmeg.OrderedCollection



java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.Nutmeg.Collection
           |
           +----java.Nutmeg.IndexedCollection
                   |
                   +----java.Nutmeg.OrderedCollection






  
 public class OrderedCollection
  
 extends IndexedCollection


Copyright (c) 1995, 1996 THOUGHT Inc. All Rights Reserved.

OrderedCollection class (a growable IndexedCollection with Ordering).

An OrderedCollection is a kind of Collection where the objects are
guaranteed to be placed in the order in which they were added.





  




  
 
	OrderedCollection(int, int)
  
 Constructor for OrderedCollection with an initial storage capacity
and a specified growSize.
  
 
	OrderedCollection(int)
  
 Constructs an empty OrderedCollection with the specified storage 
capacity, and a default capacity increment.
  
 
	OrderedCollection()
  
 Construct an empty OrderedCollection.




  




  
 
	addAfter(Object, Object)
  
 Add anObject after newObject.
  
 
	addAfter(Object, int)
  
 Inserts the specified object at the specified index.
  
 
	addAllFirst(Collection)
  
 Take all of the Objects contained in aCollection and add them to this
OrderedCollection before it's first Object.
  
 
	addAllLast(Collection)
  
 Take all of the Objects contained in aCollection and add them to this
OrderedCollection after it's last Object.
  
 
	addBefore(Object, Object)
  
 Inserts the specified object before the specified index.
  
 
	addBefore(Object, int)
  
 Inserts the specified object before the specified index.
  
 
	addFirst(Object)
  
 Add anObject as the first Object in this OrderedCollection.
  
 
	addLast(Object)
  
 Add anObject as the last Object in this OrderedCollection.
  
 
	after(Object)
  
 
Return the object immediately after anObject in this OrderedCollection.
  
 
	after(Object, DoBlock)
  
 
Return the object immediately after anObject in this OrderedCollection,
If no Objects found which match anObject, then execute doBlock.
  
 
	atIfAbsent(int, DoBlock)
  
 Return the object at the location anInt, if anInt is not a valid
location, then execute doBlock.
  
 
	atPut(int, Object)
  
 At the location anInt, put anObject.
  
 
	before(Object)
  
 
Return the object immediately before anObject in this OrderedCollection,
If anObject is the first object in the OrderedCollection, then either
throw an exception or return null depending on whether you're operating
in java or Smalltalk mode.
  
 
	before(Object, DoBlock)
  
 
Return the object immediately before anObject in this OrderedCollection,
If anObject is the first object in the OrderedCollection or it is not
found, then execute the doBlock and then either throw an exception or 
return null depending on whether you're operating in java or Smalltalk 
mode.
  
 
	clone()
  
 Clone this OrderedCollection.
  
 
	initPositions(int)
  
 Ensures that the OrderedCollecion has at least the specified capacity.
  
 
	putSpaceAfter(int)
  
 Insert a null Object after anInt in the Collection.
  
 
	putSpaceAtEnd()
  
 Insert a null Object at the end of the Collection.
  
 
	putSpaceAtStart()
  
 Insert a null Object at the beginning of the Collection.
  
 
	removeFirst()
  
 Remove the first Object from the list and return it to the caller.
  
 
	removeIfAbsent(Object, DoBlock)
  
 Remove the first Object from the OrderedCollection which matches
anObject.
  
 
	removeIndex(int)
  
 Remove the object at anInt and retur it's value to the caller.
  
 
	removeLast()
  
 Remove the last Object from the list and return it to the caller.
  
 
	startPositionEndPosition(int, int)
  
 Trim an OrderedCollection to only those objects between the start
and end locations.





  




OrderedCollection

  public OrderedCollection(int initialSize,
                           int growSize)




  
 Constructor for OrderedCollection with an initial storage capacity
and a specified growSize.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 initialSize - initial storage capacity of data storage
    
 growSize - the increment that storage should grow by
size doubles if value is 0.
  




OrderedCollection

  public OrderedCollection(int initialSize)




  
 Constructs an empty OrderedCollection with the specified storage 
capacity, and a default capacity increment.  Capacity increment is 
defaulted to 0 using this constructor.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 initialSize - initial storage capacity of data storage.
  




OrderedCollection

  public OrderedCollection()




  
 Construct an empty OrderedCollection.  This defaults to an initial 
storage of 10 and a capacity increment of 0.





  



addAfter

  public synchronized void addAfter(Object newObject,
                                    Object anObject)




  
 Add anObject after newObject.  If newObject is not found, then
don't add Object, and produce exception.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 newObject - Object to be added.
    
 anObject - Object to be looked up.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index
  




addAfter

  public synchronized void addAfter(Object newObject,
                                    int anInt)




  
 Inserts the specified object at the specified index.
Objects with an index greater to the index are shifted up.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 newObject - the object to insert
    
 anInt - where to insert the new object
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index
  




addBefore

  public synchronized void addBefore(Object newObject,
                                     Object oldObject)




  
 Inserts the specified object before the specified index.
Objects with an index greater or equal to the index are shifted up.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 newObject - the Object to insert
    
 oldObject - Object located where the new Object is to be inserted
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index
  




addBefore

  public synchronized void addBefore(Object newObject,
                                     int anInt)




  
 Inserts the specified object before the specified index.
Objects with an index greater or equal to the index are shifted up.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 newObject - the new Object to insert
    
 anInt - where to insert the new Object
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index
  




addAllFirst

  public synchronized void addAllFirst(Collection aCollection)




  
 Take all of the Objects contained in aCollection and add them to this
OrderedCollection before it's first Object.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 aCollection - The Collection containing Objects to be inserted.
  




addAllLast

  public synchronized void addAllLast(Collection aCollection)




  
 Take all of the Objects contained in aCollection and add them to this
OrderedCollection after it's last Object.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 aCollection - The Collection containing Objects to be inserted.
  




addFirst

  public synchronized void addFirst(Object anObject)




  
 Add anObject as the first Object in this OrderedCollection.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - The object to be added.
  




addLast

  public synchronized void addLast(Object anObject)




  
 Add anObject as the last Object in this OrderedCollection.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - The Object to be added.
  




after

  public final synchronized Object after(Object anObject)




  
 Return the object immediately after anObject in this OrderedCollection.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - The Object to look up.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index.
  




after

  public final synchronized Object after(Object anObject,
                                         DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Return the object immediately after anObject in this OrderedCollection,
If no Objects found which match anObject, then execute doBlock.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - The Object to look up.
    
 doBlock - The block to execute if no matching Object was found.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index.
  




atIfAbsent

  public final synchronized Object atIfAbsent(int anInt,
                                              DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Return the object at the location anInt, if anInt is not a valid
location, then execute doBlock.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anInt - The location of the Object to return.
    
 doBlock - The block to execute if anInt is not found.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index
  




atPut

  public synchronized void atPut(int anInt,
                                 Object anObject)




  
 At the location anInt, put anObject.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anInt - The location of the Object to return.
    
 doBlock - The block to execute if anInt is not found.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index
  




before

  public final synchronized Object before(Object anObject)




  
 Return the object immediately before anObject in this OrderedCollection,
If anObject is the first object in the OrderedCollection, then either
throw an exception or return null depending on whether you're operating
in java or Smalltalk mode.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - The Object to look up.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index.
  




before

  public final synchronized Object before(Object anObject,
                                          DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Return the object immediately before anObject in this OrderedCollection,
If anObject is the first object in the OrderedCollection or it is not
found, then execute the doBlock and then either throw an exception or 
return null depending on whether you're operating in java or Smalltalk 
mode.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - The Object to look up.
    
 doBlock - The DoBlock to execute if anObject is not found.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index.
  




initPositions

  public final synchronized void initPositions(int capacity)




  
 Ensures that the OrderedCollecion has at least the specified capacity.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 capacity - the desired minimum capacity
  




putSpaceAfter

  public final synchronized void putSpaceAfter(int anInt)




  
 Insert a null Object after anInt in the Collection.
Objects with an index greater or equal to the anInt are shifted up.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anInt - where to insert the new null Object
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index.
  




putSpaceAtEnd

  public final synchronized void putSpaceAtEnd()




  
 Insert a null Object at the end of the Collection.
  

    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index.
  




putSpaceAtStart

  public final synchronized void putSpaceAtStart()




  
 Insert a null Object at the beginning of the Collection.
  

    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index.
  




removeIfAbsent

  public final synchronized void removeIfAbsent(Object anObject,
                                                DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Remove the first Object from the OrderedCollection which matches
anObject.  If no Objects are found to match, then call doBlock.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - The object to match.
    
 doBlock - The block to execute if anObject not found.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index.
  




removeFirst

  public final synchronized Object removeFirst()




  
 Remove the first Object from the list and return it to the caller.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 Object The value that is removed, null if none in list.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index.
  




removeIndex

  public final synchronized Object removeIndex(int anInt)




  
 Remove the object at anInt and retur it's value to the caller.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anInt - where to insert the new object
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index.
  




removeLast

  public final synchronized Object removeLast()




  
 Remove the last Object from the list and return it to the caller.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 Object The value that is removed, null if none in list.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index.
  




startPositionEndPosition

  public final synchronized void startPositionEndPosition(int startPos,
                                                          int endPos)




  
 Trim an OrderedCollection to only those objects between the start
and end locations.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 start - The beginning location.
    
 end - The ending location.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 invalid index.
  




clone

  public synchronized Object clone()




  
 Clone this OrderedCollection. The objects are not cloned.
  

    
 Overrides:
    
 clone in class IndexedCollection
